noun.description: Talk that aims to charm, pleasantly flatter, or persuade.
examples: he had the “street charm” of an Irish politician, but this blarney concealed his inner self

verb.description: Influence or persuade (someone) using charm and pleasant flattery.

origin: Late 18th century: named after Blarney, a castle near Cork in Ireland, where there is a stone said to give the gift of persuasive speech to anyone who kisses it.
